Class MaxHeap

java.lang.Object
MaxHeap
All Implemented Interfaces:
MaxHeapInterface
public class MaxHeap
extends java.lang.Object
implements MaxHeapInterface
MaxHeap class implemented with an array.
Author:
Joseph

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    MaxHeap()
    Constructs a MaxHeap with the default capacity.
    MaxHeap​(int initialCapacity)
    Constructs a MaxHeap with a given capacity.
    MaxHeap​(int[] entries)
    Constructs a MaxHeap using reheap when given an array of entries.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void add​(int newEntry)
    Adds an entry to the heap.
    void clear()
    Clears the heap of all entries.
    int getMax()
    Retrieves the max (the root).
    int getReheapCount()
    Returns number of reheaps.
    int getSize()
    Gets current size of heap.
    boolean isEmpty()
    Checks if the heap is empty.
    int[] printTen()
    Returns first ten integers of MaxHeap.
    void reheap​(int rootIndex)
    The smarter way of constructing a max-heap, by repeatedly using reheap, which is faster than adding the entries by size the normal way.
    int removeMax()
    Removes the max (the root).
    int[] toArray()
    To array.

    • reheap

      public void reheap​(int rootIndex)
      The smarter way of constructing a max-heap, by repeatedly using reheap, which is faster than adding the entries by size the normal way.
      Parameters:
      rootIndex - The index to reheap.
